gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਦਰਸ ਧਿਅਾਨ ਗਿਅਾਨ ਅੰਜਮ ਕੈ ਮਿਤ੍ਰ ਸਤ੍ਰਤਾ ਨਿਵਾਰੀ ਪੂਰਨ ਬ੍ਹਮ ਹੈ
transliteration: Satigur Daras Dhiaan Giaan Anjam Kai , Mitr Satrataa Nivaaree Pooran Braham Hai ?
translation: By concentrating mind on the vision and by toiling on Naam Simran with rapt attention, one destroys all enmity and friendship and experiences presence of One Lord God.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ੳੁਪਦੇਸ ਪਰਵੇਸ ਅਾਦਿ ਕੳੁ ਅਾਦੇਸ ੳੁਸਤਤਿ ਨਿੰਦਾ ਮੇਟਿ ਗੰਮਿਤਾ ਅਗਮ ਹੈ
transliteration: Gur Oupadays Paravays Aadi Kau Aadaysa , Ousatati Nindaa Mayti Ganmitaa Agam Hai ?
translation: By imbibing the words of the Guru in one's heart and by the counsel of the True Guru can one indulge in His praise humbly. All desires of praise and slander are destroyed and one reaches the inaccessible Lord.

gurmukhi: ਚਰਨ ਸਰਨਿ ਗਹੇ ਧਾਵਤ ਬਰਜਿ ਰਾਖੇ ਅਾਸਾ ਮਨਸਾ ਥਕਤ ਸਫਲ ਜਨਮ ਹੈ
transliteration: Charan Sarani Gahay Dhaavat Baraji Raakhay , Aasaa Manasaa Dakat Sadhal Janam Hai ?
translation: By taking the refuge of a True Guru, a mind chasing vices and other evil pleasures come to rest. All desires and expectations end. Thus a human birth becomes a success.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧੁ ਸੰਗਿ ਪ੍ਰੇਮ ਨੇਮ ਜੀਵਨ ਮੁਕਤਿ ਗਤਿ ਕਾਮ ਨਿਹਕਾਮ ਨਿਹਕਰਮ ਕਰਮ ਹੈ ||੮੨||
transliteration: Saadhu Sangi Praym Naym Jeevan Moukati Gati , Kaam Nihakaam Nihakaram Karam Hai ?82?
translation: By joining the holy congregation of a God-like True Guru. the loving promise or pious resolution is fulfilled and one reaches the state of emancipation while still alive (Jeevan Mukt). One feels pacified towards worldly desires and indulges more in noble
